packages.description:
## Package overview

This Package provides the functionality required to access and manipulate data stored in a MySQL database.  

**Prerequisite:** Add the MySQL driver JAR as a native library dependency in your Ballerina project. 
This Package uses database properties from the MySQL version 8.0.x onwards. Therefore, it is recommended to use a 
MySQL driver version greater than 8.0.x. Then, once you build the project by executing the `ballerina build`
command, you should be able to run the resultant by executing the `ballerina run` command.

E.g., The `Ballerina.toml` content.
Change the path to the JDBC driver appropriately.

```toml
[package]
org = "sample"
name = "mysql"
version= "0.1.0"

[[platform.java11.dependency]]
artifactId = "mysql-connector-java"
version = "8.0.17"
path = "/path/to/mysql-connector-java-8.0.17.jar"
groupId = "mysql"
``` 

### Client
To access a database, you must first create a 
[mysql:Client](https://ballerina.io/learn/api-docs/ballerina/#/mysql/clients/Client) object. 
The examples for creating a MySQL client can be found below.

#### Creating a client
This example shows different ways of creating the `mysql:Client`. 

The client can be created with an empty constructor and hence, the client will be initialized with the default properties. 
The first example with the `dbClient1` demonstrates this.

The `dbClient2` receives the host, username, and password. Since the properties are passed in the same order as it is defined 
in the `jdbc:Client`, you can pass it without named params.

The `dbClient3` uses the named params to pass the attributes since it is skipping some params in the constructor. 
Further [mysql:Options](https://ballerina.io/learn/api-docs/ballerina/#/mysql/records/Options) 
is passed to configure the SSL and connection timeout in the MySQL client. 

Similarly, the `dbClient4` uses the named params and it provides an unshared connection pool in the type of 
[sql:ConnectionPool](https://ballerina.io/learn/api-docs/ballerina/#/sql/records/ConnectionPool) 
to be used within the client. 
For more details about connection pooling, see the [SQL Package](https://ballerina.io/learn/api-docs/ballerina/#/sql).

```ballerina
mysql:Client|sql:Error dbClient1 = new ();
mysql:Client|sql:Error dbClient2 = new ("localhost", "rootUser", "rooPass", 
                              "information_schema", 3306);
                              
mysql:Options mysqlOptions = {
  ssl: {
    mode: mysql:SSL_PREFERRED
  },
  connectTimeout: 10
};
mysql:Client|sql:Error dbClient3 = new (user = "rootUser", password = "rootPass",
                              options = mysqlOptions);
mysql:Client|sql:Error dbClient4 = new (user = "rootUser", password = "rootPass",
                              connectionPool = {maxOpenConnections: 5});
```
You can find more details about each property in the
[mysql:Client](https://ballerina.io/learn/api-docs/ballerina/#/mysql/clients/Client) constructor. 

The [mysql:Client](https://ballerina.io/learn/api-docs/ballerina/#/mysql/clients/Client) references 
[sql:Client](https://ballerina.io/learn/api-docs/ballerina/#/sql/abstractObjects/Client) and all the operations 
defined by the `sql:Client` will be supported by the `mysql:Client` as well. 

For more information on all the operations supported by the `mysql:Client`, which include the below, see the [SQL Package](https://ballerina.io/learn/api-docs/ballerina/#/sql).

1. Connection Pooling
2. Querying data
3. Inserting data
4. Updating data
5. Deleting data
6. Batch insert and update data
7. Execute stored procedures
8. Closing client

fields.name: connectTimeout
fields.description: Timeout (in seconds) to be used when connecting to the mysql server

fields.name: socketTimeout
fields.description:
Socket timeout (in seconds) during the read/write operations with mysql server,
0 means no socket timeout

fields.name: mode
fields.description: `SSLMode` to be used during the connection

fields.name: clientCertKeystore
fields.description: Keystore configuration of the client certificates

fields.name: trustCertKeystore
fields.description: Keystore configuration of the trust certificates

records.name: SSLConfig
records.description: SSL Configuration to be used when connecting to mysql server.

parameters.name: sqlQuery
parameters.description:
The query which needs to be executed as `string` or `ParameterizedQuery` when the SQL query has
params to be passed in

parameters.name: rowType
parameters.description:
The `typedesc` of the record that should be returned as a result. If this is not provided the default
column names of the query result set be used for the record attributes.

returnParameters.description: Stream of records in the type of `rowType`

remoteMethods.name: query
remoteMethods.description: Queries the database with the query provided by the user, and returns the result as stream.

parameters.name: sqlQuery
parameters.description:
The DDL or DML query such as INSERT, DELETE, UPDATE, etc as `string` or `ParameterizedQuery`
when the query has params to be passed in

returnParameters.description:
Summary of the sql update query as `ExecutionResult` or returns `Error`
if any error occurred when executing the query

remoteMethods.name: execute
remoteMethods.description: Executes the DDL or DML sql queries provided by the user, and returns summary of the execution.

parameters.name: sqlQueries
parameters.description:
The DDL or DML query such as INSERT, DELETE, UPDATE, etc as `ParameterizedQuery` with an array
of values passed in

returnParameters.description:
Summary of the executed SQL queries as `ExecutionResult[]` which includes details such as
`affectedRowCount` and `lastInsertId`. If one of the commands in the batch fails, this function
will return `BatchExecuteError`, however the JDBC driver may or may not continue to process the
remaining commands in the batch after a failure. The summary of the executed queries in case of error
can be accessed as `(<sql:BatchExecuteError> result).detail()?.executionResults`.

remoteMethods.name: batchExecute
remoteMethods.description:
Executes a batch of parameterized DDL or DML sql query provided by the user,
and returns the summary of the execution.

parameters.name: sqlQuery
parameters.description: The query to execute the SQL stored procedure

parameters.name: rowTypes
parameters.description:
The array of `typedesc` of the records that should be returned as a result. If this is not provided
the default column names of the query result set be used for the record attributes.

returnParameters.description: Summary of the execution is returned in `ProcedureCallResult` or `sql:Error`

remoteMethods.name: call
remoteMethods.description: Executes a SQL stored procedure and returns the result as stream and execution summary.

parameters.name: host
parameters.description: Hostname of the mysql server to be connected

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: If the mysql server is secured, the username to be used to connect to the mysql server

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: The password of provided username of the database

parameters.name: database
parameters.description: The name fo the database to be connected

parameters.name: port
parameters.description: Port number of the mysql server to be connected

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: The Database specific JDBC client properties

parameters.name: connectionPool
parameters.description:
The `sql:ConnectionPool` object to be used within the jdbc client.
If there is no connectionPool is provided, the global connection pool will be used and it will
be shared by other clients which has same properties.

parameters.name: sqlQuery
parameters.description:
The query which needs to be executed as `string` or `ParameterizedQuery` when the SQL query has
params to be passed in

parameters.name: rowType
parameters.description:
The `typedesc` of the record that should be returned as a result. If this is not provided the default
column names of the query result set be used for the record attributes.

returnParameters.description: Stream of records in the type of `rowType`

methods.description: Queries the database with the query provided by the user, and returns the result as stream.

when the query has params to be passed in

if any error occurred when executing the query

methods.description:
Executes a batch of parameterized DDL or DML sql query provided by the user,
and returns the summary of the execution.

parameters.description: The query to execute the SQL stored procedure

parameters.description:
The array of `typedesc` of the records that should be returned as a result. If this is not provided

returnParameters.description: Possible error during closing the client

types.name: SSLMode
types.description: SSLMode as a union of available ssl modes.
